meanings.definition: A ring of cartilage around the socket of a joint.
meanings.sent1: The labrum in my knee helps cushion the joint.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the labrum in my shoulder was torn.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my labrum was the body's own little cushion.
meanings.sent4: The labrum, like a protective ring, supports the joint.
meanings.sent5: The labrum acts as a buffer for the joint, preventing friction.

meanings.definition: A lip or edge, especially of a body part.
meanings.sent1: Her lower lip trembled, revealing a delicate labrum.
meanings.sent2: The labrum of the pitcher's mouth was chapped from the cold.
meanings.sent3: He admired the smooth labrum of the seashell.
meanings.sent4: The labrum of the cliff was eroded by the crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The labrum of the leaf curled elegantly in the breeze.
